faq.title: Frequently asked questions.
faq.copy: Short reads that cover the topics we hear about most from teams and families alike.

items.question: How fast will support reply to my ticket?
items.answer: We respond to most enquiries within one business day. Pilot partners and consulting teams have a dedicated escalation inbox with a four-hour response window during business hours.

items.question: Where can I find training for my classroom or team?
items.answer: Download facilitator packs in the resources section below or join our monthly live onboarding circles. Each session includes recordings, transcripts, and bilingual worksheets.

items.question: Do you offer Sla-backed support for enterprises?
items.answer: Yes. Consulting retainers include a AI operations handbook, quarterly architecture reviews, and priority response for critical issues. Contact us to tailor the Sla to your team size and region.

items.question: Is content available in multiple languages?
items.answer: Core help articles ship in English, Latvian, and Russian today, with French, Spanish, and Ukrainian arriving through 2026. Articles note their translation status and provide request links for additional languages.

status.title: Transparent updates for every product.
status.copy: Follow current uptime, upcoming maintenance, and resolved incidents. Each update links to its full report when available.

items.description: NodeVoyage APIs, Ideonautix modules, and contact channels are running smoothly. Next maintenance window: 20 April 2026 (rolling restart, < 10 minutes).
We are translating the consulting playbook and Ideonautix Pomodoro Coach docs into French and Spanish. Articles remain available; expect incremental updates daily.
An infrastructure upgrade briefly delayed cross-device sync for Ideonautix workspaces. We added automated integrity checks and published the root-cause report in the resources archive.

escalation.title: Reach our support crew.
escalation.copy: If you cannot find what you need, our humans are ready. Choose a channel that matches your urgency and we will guide you every step.

suggestions.title: Explore our AI lab
suggestions.prompt: What makes Algorhythmics different from other AI studios?

suggestions.title: NodeVoyage tool
suggestions.prompt: Give me the highlights of the NodeVoyage travel tool.

suggestions.title: Ideonautix suite
suggestions.prompt: How does the Ideonautix productivity suite support teams?

suggestions.title: Improve my AI strategy.
suggestions.prompt: How could Algorhythmics level up our AI initiative?

knowledgeBase.answer: Algorhythmics pairs workshop-grade engineering with a relaxed communication style. We ship our own flagships while coaching partners through the same R&D.
NodeVoyage is our intelligent travel guide. Graph-powered itineraries, contextual storytelling, and adaptive agents help every trip feel personal and stress-free.
Ideonautix is a suite of collaborative AI helpers for knowledge teams. It supports idea making sessions, decision intelligence, and automation while keeping humans in control.
Reach our consulting crew through the contact page or email hello@Algorhythmics.com. We love shaping proofs of concept and long-term partnerships alike.
Start with a discovery sprint: we map your goals, audit current data flows, and co-design a focused AI helper. Together we plan iteration loops so momentum lasts.

ai_companion.fallback: I'm still learning, yet I can connect you with the team or share highlights about our products, studio culture, and services.

hero.title: Ideonautix
hero.subtitle: Explore. Invent. Launch. Your modular AI workspace for founders, students, and creative teams.
hero.description: Ideonautix keeps momentum steady with helpers for pitching, research, and focus. Build presentations, run experiments, and manage with explainable AI nudges that honour your process.

modules.title: Tools that keep ideas moving.
modules.lead: Ideonautix pairs playful visuals with serious operations. Every module lives inside a windowed workspace so you can drag, resize, and focus without losing the bigger picture.

cards.title: Pitch Deck helper
cards.copy: Answer a short creative brief and Ideonautix drafts slides, speaker notes, and evidence to fit your audience—with transparent citations and edit history.

cards.title: Competitive Dashboard.
cards.copy: Track market shifts, competitor releases, and trend digests curated for your vertical. Summaries stay human-readable and exportable.

cards.title: Pomodoro Coach
cards.copy: Keep your rhythm with adaptive focus sessions, break prompts, and gentle accountability nudges based on your schedule.

cards.title: steps Library
cards.copy: Mix-and-match canvases for OKRs, research sprints, and retrospectives. Each template includes guidance drawn from our consulting.

cards.title: AI Brainstorm
cards.copy: Bounce ideas with a multilingual AI co-founder trained on ethical new playbooks. Every suggestion ships with rationale and references.

status.title: Pilot in early 2026
status.copy: We are inviting a small circle of founders, educators, and student teams to shape Ideonautix. Pilot members test modules, share feedback in live sessions, and receive lifetime discounts when we launch publicly in spring 2026.
bullets: Multilingual interface: English & Latvian at pilot, Russian in beta.
Aaa contrast themes and reduced-motion support mirror our design system.
All AI suggestions include citations and exportable audit trails.

use_cases.title: Stories from the lab
use_cases.copy: Ideonautix was born from our consulting. Each pilot builds on real problems founders and educators face when they lack clear documentation or accessible AI support.

items.name: Anna · Student entrepreneur.
items.story: Anna used Ideonautix to map a sustainable fashion concept. The pitch helper built a grant-ready deck, while Pomodoro Coach kept her team on track for demo day.

items.name: SafeRide · Mobility startup.
items.story: SafeRide analysed competitors and regulatory news through the dashboard, rapidly iterated prototypes, and walked into investor meetings with confidence.

hero.title: NodeVoyage
hero.subtitle: Fun. Travel. Memories. Community. Your AI travel companion that keeps every explorer in the loop.
hero.description: Describe your dream journey and Nodi run an itinerary with accessibility, sustainability, and surprise in mind. Plan with friends in real time, translate signs on the go, and capture stories that outlast the flight home.

features.title: What makes NodeVoyage different?
features.lead: NodeVoyage feels like a playful Travel Tools: windowed layouts, frosted panels, and an AI buddy who keeps plans tidy while celebrating spontaneity.

cards.title: Smart Trip Planner
cards.copy: Tell Nodi how you want to feel on your next adventure. NodeVoyage balances hidden gems with essentials, make better routes, and adjusts for mobility or sensory needs automatically.

cards.title: Collaborative Crews
cards.copy: Invite family, friends, or classmates into a shared travel canvas. Vote on ideas, track who is editing, and keep everyone aligned with notifications.

cards.title: AR Translation & Capture.
cards.copy: Use the mobile app to translate menus, capture audio notes, or pin AR “memory anchors” to revisit favourite spots later.

cards.title: Eco & Community Missions.
cards.copy: Earn badges for low-impact choices, community storytelling, and cultural challenges curated with local partners.

cards.title: Travel Journal & Reel.
cards.copy: After the trip, NodeVoyage weaves your photos, notes, and check-ins into a shareable story or highlight reel—always with edit controls and privacy toggles.

roadmap.title: 2026 journey
roadmap.lead: We are building NodeVoyage out in the open. Each phase brings more collaborative magic while reinforcing accessibility, localisation, and transparent AI coaching.

items.details: First wave of explorers test collaborative itineraries, AR translation, and sustainability missions alongside our team.
Expanded language support, travel journal exports, and integrations with accessibility partners land for summer adventures.
Goal of 10,000 travellers across Latvia and neighbouring regions, with classroom pilots and tourism collaborations.

differentiators.title: , trustworthy travel intelligence.
differentiators.lead: NodeVoyage blends projects-inspired clarity with travel storytelling. It is approachable for first-time travellers and powerful for adventure planners who want deeper context.

cards.title: AI that explains itself.
cards.copy: Every itinerary comes with plain-language reasoning, accessible alternatives, and opt-out controls.

cards.title: Inclusive by default
cards.copy: Aaa contrast themes, reduced-motion support, and multi-language content are core—not add-ons.

cards.title: Built with partners
cards.copy: Co-designed with travel educators, accessibility advocates, and projects specialists from Ideju Kauss programmes.

explorers.title: Be first aboard the beta.
explorers.copy: Leave your details to receive early access invites, mission briefs, and behind-the-scenes updates as we prepare the public beta. We keep emails minimal and never share your contact.

form.success: Thanks! We just opened your email client so you can confirm the request.
form.privacy: By joining, you agree to receive NodeVoyage development updates. You can unsubscribe anytime and we will only use your email for these messages.
form.error: Add a valid email so we can send your invite.
form.subject: NodeVoyage Explorers Club signup.

cta.title: Curious about Ideonautix too?
cta.copy: If you are exploring NodeVoyage for team retreats or student programmes, take a look at Ideonautix—our Startup Tools that keeps creative projects on track. Both tools share the same inclusive design system.

valueProps.title: Inclusive design
valueProps.body: Accessible in EN Â· LV Â· RU.

partners.title: Trusted partners
partners.body: Built with signage specialists and educators.

cta.title: Bring AI to your classroom.
cta.body: Share your goals and we will tailor the pilot.

faq.question: Who can join the pilot?
faq.answer: Latvian schools, vocational programmes, and Liaa partners.

faq.question: Preparation required?
faq.answer: We onboard facilitators and stay on-call during first runs.

faq.question: Do students need AI experience?
faq.answer: No. We start with fundamentals and build steadily.

hero.title: Educational Outreach & Community Building.
hero.subtitle: help learners, educators, and communities through AI.
hero.description: Algorhythmics is as much an educational movement as it is a tech studio. We nurture AI literacy across classrooms, libraries, and community hubs with programs that welcome every age.

intro.why_copy: Early exposure to AI concepts nurtures curiosity, confidence, and ethical awareness. Our outreach programmes are designed with projects clarity, playful experimentation, and rigorous safeguards so every learner can participate.
intro.partners_copy: We build bridges between schools, parents, industry mentors, and cultural partners. The result is a supportive set of tools where logic and creativity collaborate in real time.
how_items: Co-create pilots with educators and align them with national curricula.
Pair every workshop with inclusive materials and multilingual support.
Document outcomes so communities can continue the rhythm independently.

partnerships.title: Anchors for learners, families, and mentors.
partnerships.copy: From nationwide initiatives to after-school labs, each partnership invites communities to experience AI as something welcoming and responsible.

liaa.title: Liaa Partnership
liaa.copy: As the education sector ambassador with Latvia's Investment and Development Agency (Liaa), we co-create policy-ready pilots that bring AI literacy into formal curricula.
bullets: Curriculum integration with bilingual lesson kits and signage-inspired visuals.
Teacher coaching cohorts and certification pathways that demystify AI.
Shared research loops to publish findings and refine national standards.

schools.title: School Programs
schools.copy: We turn on classrooms with experiential AI—coding clubs, new labs, and creative sprints where students see logic dance with imagination.
bullets: Plug-and-play project modules for math, science, arts, and humanities.
Workshops where students train mini AIs, compose generative art, or design ethical guidelines.
Free or subsidised Ideonautix access so practice continues beyond the bell.

community.title: Community Events
community.copy: Monthly workshops, webinars, and neighbourhood hackathons make AI approachable for parents, professionals, and the next wave of makers.
bullets: Open-to-all sessions that explain machine learning with tangible analogies.
Parent Ambassador Network where families co-host learning circles at libraries.
Guest mentors from industry and culture bridging real projects with storytelling.

cultural.title: Cultural Partnerships.
cultural.copy: Museums, libraries, and creative labs collaborate with Algorhythmics to blend technology with heritage—sparking curiosity across generations.
bullets: AI + Art exhibits that translate algorithms into sound, movement, and light.
Story-driven installations where elders and kids explore AI together.
Shared archives of lesson prompts and accessible exhibition guides.

teachers.label: Teachers trained
teachers.description: Certified through our AI pedagogy labs.

students.label: Students engaged
students.description: Across clubs, camps, and classroom pilots.

goal.label: Goal for 2026
goal.description: Onboarded with ready-to-run AI literacy modules.

feedback.label: Positive feedback
feedback.description: Educators reporting higher confidence in teaching AI topics.

impact.note: Metrics guide our iteration, but the stories matter most—like the student who chose a tech career after an Algorhythmics camp or the teacher who now leads AI clubs with confidence.

global.title: A global rhythm of shared learning.
global.copy: Our outreach stretches beyond Latvia through European education networks, exchange programs, and shared research. Students collaborate across borders, trading ideas and building empathy through responsible AI projects.

finale.title: Get involved with Algorhythmics outreach.
finale.copy: Students, educators, parents, and sponsors are welcome. We will help you run workshops, integrate curriculum, or spark community events that pair logic with creativity.

hero.title: Education Hub: AI stories & learning paths.

hero.description: Explore how AI comes to life across classrooms, studios, and cities. Our Education Hub curates stories, toolkits, and events so every learner can join the rhythm.
highlights: Aaa-accessible articles translated across six languages.
Classroom-ready toolkits shaped with teachers and families.
Monthly community events with recordings & transcripts.

featured.title: How a Riga classroom built a AI newsroom.
featured.summary: Students co-created responsible reporting steps with Ideonautix, pairing projects-inspired with explainable automation.

toolkits.copy: Downloadable lesson arcs, operating guides, and family activities designed with accessibility at the core.

spotlights.label: Community spotlights

spotlights.copy: Follow pilots, residencies, and community experiments that show AI in action.

events.label: Upcoming events
events.title: Upcoming workshops, webinars & community jams.
events.copy: Join sessions where we sketch prototypes together, explore ethical guardrails, and celebrate student showcases. Most events include live captioning and recorded replays.

newsletter.copy: Monthly highlights with new toolkits, impact stories, and early invites to pilots. Short, friendly, and focused on actionable inspiration.

cta.title: Letâ€™s build AI together.
cta.body: Bring your roadmap and we will map the.

hero.title: AI, crafted in Riga and Rotterdam.
hero.subtitle: We are a Latvian-born studio where algorithms and artistry share the same rhythm. Our work blends projects precision, inclusive design, and playful experimentation.
hero.description: Founded in 2025 by technologists and educators, Algorhythmics believes logic and creativity belong together. From AI tools to classroom pilots, we choreograph solutions that explain themselves and invite collaboration.

story.heading: Who we are
story.intro: What began as a small startup in Riga has grown into a bridge between education, culture, and industry. Early collaborations with Latvia's Investment and Development Agency (Liaa) helped us champion AI education nationwide.
story.culture: Inside the studio we host Logic/Dance sessions—one day a data science hackathon, the next an improv design workshop. This fusion of play and rigor shapes the experiences we ship.
milestones: Launched pilot programmes in local schools where students built projects with our tools and saw their ideas come alive.
Tailored Ideonautix for startups after listening to founders who needed, creative productivity support.
Expanded partnerships with museums, libraries, and international conferences—proving that logic and art thrive together.

values.title: Where logic dances with creativity.
values.copy: Our mission is simple: make advanced AI accessible, enjoyable, and trustworthy. We pursue this mission through values that keep people at the centre.

education_first.title: Education first
education_first.copy: We nurture AI literacy in classrooms and community hubs. Free resources and respectful mentorship keep curiosity alive for every learner.

empowerment.title: Empowerment through technology.
empowerment.copy: Whether you are a founder, teacher, or student, our tools are designed to feel welcoming, intuitive, and human-centred.

integrity.title: new with integrity
integrity.copy: Ethical guardrails, privacy, and transparency guide every release. We document automation decisions in plain language so trust stays intact.

community.title: Community & collaboration.
community.copy: Partnerships with parents, cultural institutions, and industry mentors turn AI into a shared dance rather than a solo act.

team.title: The people behind the rhythm.
team.copy: Our team spans AI researchers, designers, educators, and community builders. Meet the founders who set the tone for collaboration and craft.

nikita.name: Nikita Jurtaevs
nikita.focus: Signage craft, storytelling, and partner delivery.
nikita.bio: Nikita keeps product direction, accessibility, and partnerships aligned. He brings signage-floor realism to every interface and programme.

slaff.name: Vjaceslavs "Slaff" Trosins.
slaff.focus: Cloud architecture, explainable AI, and operations.
slaff.bio: Slaff run engineering, data flows, and AI integrations. He connects hardware-grade discipline with transparent software experiences.

finale.title: Join the rhythm
finale.copy: We welcome collaborators who care about accessible technology, joyful learning, and responsible automation. Whether you are exploring careers, partnerships, or sponsorships, let’s build together.

hero.title: Services & Solutions for, Creative AI.
hero.subtitle: Discover how Algorhythmics blends consulting, flagship tools, and education to move ideas from spark to launch.
hero.description: Whether you are integrating AI into operations, equipping classrooms, or piloting a new product, our team choreographs the rhythm from strategy to support.

consulting.title: Strategy that keeps pace with your team.
consulting.copy: Every engagement starts with projects-inspired clarity and ends with teams who understand their tools. These services pair with measurable outcomes.

consulting.title: AI Consulting & Integration.
consulting.summary: use our founder-led consulting to map opportunities, translate them into transparent automation, and deliver AI that teams actually trust.
bullets: Discovery workshops that decode steps and user journeys.
Pilot sprints with explainable automation notes and opt-out paths.
Change-management playbooks and training to keep crews confident.

implementation.title: Technical Implementation & Training.
implementation.summary: We stay on deck after the strategy is signed off. Our team deploys, documents, and trains your people so, inclusive AI becomes routine.
bullets: Hands-on configuration across cloud, data, and governance checkpoints.
Aaa-accessible documentation, onboarding guides, and office hours.
Ongoing success metrics and iteration roadmaps tuned to your rhythm.

platforms.title: Products where logic dances with creativity.
platforms.copy: Our studio tools are living proof of the methodologies we teach. They inherit the same frosted-glass, multilingual access, and rhythm you will feel in every engagement.

ideonautix.title: Ideonautix
ideonautix.summary: An AI partner for founders, educators, and teams who need momentum. Brainstorm, storyboard, and run projects with clarity and delight.
bullets: AI Pitch helper for decks, grants, and stakeholder updates.
Collaborative canvases that balance focus dashboards with playful prompts.
Inclusive localisation and voice options for multilingual communities.

nodevoyage.title: NodeVoyage
nodevoyage.summary: Plan journeys with a companion that choreographs logistics and wonder. From family trips to nomad itineraries, NodeVoyage adapts to every explorer.
bullets: Personalised itineraries with live context, accessibility, and language options.
Route optimisation and collaborative trip workspaces for teams or classrooms.
Hospitality-ready previews for partners and agencies.

education.eyebrow: Built with Liaa and Baltic schools.
education.title: Educational Programs & Partnerships.
education.summary: Bring AI literacy into classrooms, libraries, and community hubs. We co-design workshops, curriculum modules, and mentorship sprints that welcome every learner.
bullets: Curriculum blueprints, teacher training, and ready-to-run lesson plans.
Community hackathons, parent ambassador network, and internship pathways.
Impact tracking dashboards tuned to student confidence and reach goals.

finale.title: Let’s choreograph your next milestone.
finale.copy: Share your roadmap, pain points, or classrooms and we will assemble the right mix of consulting, tools, and education support., human-centred AI is a conversation away.
